sentences: Mauricio Buraglia (born 1954 in Bogotà) is a Colombian composer, recording-artist, musician-lutenist and theorbist of Italian descent, active in Paris, France.
Buraglia composed incidental music for Carlo Goldoni's "L'Impresario de Smyrne", for the Compagnol theater, and for the "Winter's Tale" ("Conte d'hiver") by Shakespeare, for the Amandiers theater.
"Les Plaintes de Psyché" Jacques Gallot Livre Gravé Paris and Sylvius Leopold Weiss Suite en re 35 Dresde Mauricio Buraglia (Magnatune)
